label: Letter from Abner Nash to Nathanael Greene
description: Letter from Abner Nash to Nathanael Greene reporting on the state of affairs in South Carolina and North Carolina; requesting aid in opposing Lord Cornwallis in North Carolina.

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: Letter from Abner Nash to Nathanael Greene reporting on the state of affairs in South Carolina and North Carolina; requesting aid in opposing Lord Cornwallis in North Carolina.

metadata.label: Access Note

metadata.label: Digitization Specifications

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value:
[Abner Nash to Nathanael Greene
May 7, 1781
[RvW Box 2 Folder 52; MSS. – A.L.S.]]

Dear Sir		Warren County May 7, 1781 –
I had the honour to receive yr. favr.
dated the 21. April [and] have no doubt yr. opirations [sic]
agt. the Enemys push in So Carolina will eventually
have the most Happy Effects, at the same time I am
to acqt. yu. that Ld Cornwallis  sensible of his inability
[as I suppose] to find you has marched in fulforce
into the Heart of this State they crossed Tar River at Lemons's
Ferry [?] but to what particular part
they may be bound I cannot say – I suppose [and] believe
this plan must be [?] keeping this state to call
yr. attention  from SoCarolina - [and] indeed Sir I have
little to say for the militia force of this State, I 
have been using every endeavor to draw the people
out to oppose the progress of the Enemy – as yet 
without Effect, they turn out badly and for the present
it appears that the state may be over run [and] perhaps
ruined unless you save us – our new recruits are
ready, but there is a want of good conduct in
collecting them together – I hope for the pleasure of
having favour [with] yu. [and] am with the highest respect
[and] Esteem           Dr Sir
Yr. Obt. ser.t A. Nash [Your Obedient servant Abner Nash]
[End Page 1]
[Addressed:]  The Hnble [Honorable]
Nathl Green[e] Esqr. [Nathanael Greene Esquire]
Commander in Chief in the
Southern Department
[Endorsed upside down:]  from Govr. [Governor] Nash
May 7th 1781.
[End Page 2]
